actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Government Operations.

official_title: A bill to authorize and direct the Comptroller General of the United States to hire comptrollers to examine proposed expenditures of the executive agencies to determine if each such expenditure is consistent with the legislative intent of Congress with respect to the legislation authorizing it, and if it is inconsistent, to prohibit the making of such expenditure.

summary.text: Directs the Comptroller General of the United States to hire comptrollers to examine proposed expenditures of the executive agencies to determine if each such expenditure is consistent with the legislative intent of Congress with respect to the legislation authorizing it, and if it is inconsistent, to prohibit the making of such expenditure.

titles.title: A bill to authorize and direct the Comptroller General of the United States to hire comptrollers to examine proposed expenditures of the executive agencies to determine if each such expenditure is consistent with the legislative intent of Congress with respect to the legislation authorizing it, and if it is inconsistent, to prohibit the making of such expenditure.
